mappings.notes: Rust's type system prevents implicit type conversions entirely. MISRA's 'essential type model' exists because C has implicit conversions between bool/char/numeric - Rust has none.
mappings.guideline_title: Operands shall not be of an inappropriate essential type

rejected_matches.reason: About enum discriminant memory layout, not type conversion rules

accepted_matches.reason: Per FLS: 'A cast is legal when it either performs type coercion or is a specialized cast.' All numeric conversions require explicit 'as' cast - no implicit type mixing possible.
Per FLS: Numeric widening and narrowing are NOT allowed implicitly. Only reference/pointer coercions are implicit. This prevents C's 'usual arithmetic conversions'.
Per FLS: Operands of arithmetic operators must be the SAME type. Compiler error if types don't match. MISRA's essential type mixing cannot occur.

mappings.notes: Rust's char type cannot be used in arithmetic. Explicit cast to u32/i32 required for any numeric operations on character values.
mappings.guideline_title: Expressions of essentially character type shall not be used inappropriately in addition and subtraction operations

rejected_matches.reason: About unary operators, not char arithmetic
About +=/-= etc., not char type restrictions

accepted_matches.reason: Per FLS: Rust's char is a 4-byte Unicode scalar value, NOT a numeric type. Cannot participate in arithmetic without explicit conversion.
Per FLS: Arithmetic operands must be numeric types of the same type. char is not a numeric type, so arithmetic on char is a compile error.
Per FLS: Must use explicit 'as u32' or similar to convert char to numeric. Conversion is always explicit and intentional.

mappings.notes: Rust's type system prevents implicit narrowing conversions entirely. All numeric type conversions require explicit 'as' casts. The compiler rejects assignments between incompatible types.

mappings.guideline_title: An object shall not be assigned or copied to an overlapping object
mappings.notes: Safe Rust's borrow checker prevents overlapping mutable references at compile time. FLS 15.3 explicitly states 'no other reference shall refer to a value that overlaps with the referent of the mutable reference'. In unsafe Rust, aliasing mutable references is explicitly UB.

accepted_matches.reason: PRIMARY: Per FLS fls_i1ny0k726a4a: 'While a mutable reference is active, no other reference shall refer to a value that overlaps with the referent of the mutable reference.' Also defines UB: 'It is undefined behavior to access a value through aliasing mutable references from unsafe context.'
Per FLS fls_kxws4zmaahj6: 'Borrowing a field of a union type borrows all remaining fields using the same lifetime.' This treats union fields as overlapping memory.

rejected_matches.reason: Chapter-level section too broad. Contains value overlap definition but the enforceable rules are in 15.3 References.
About tuple destructuring syntax, not memory overlap safety concerns.

mappings.guideline_title: The union keyword should not be used
mappings.notes: Rust unions exist but have strict type restrictions (Copy/ManuallyDrop field types only). Reading any union field requires unsafe context. FLS defines implementation-defined and UB scenarios similar to MISRA's concerns.

accepted_matches.reason: PRIMARY: Defines union type rules including field type restrictions per FLS fls_ZJG2Q6lJYXhY: 'The type of a union field shall be either: A copy type, or a mutable reference type, or core::mem::ManuallyDrop...'
Defines union memory layout - size is max of all fields, all fields share common storage. Addresses MISRA's padding/alignment/endianness concerns.
MANUAL: Per FLS fls_ucghxcnpaq2t: 'Accessing a field of a union, other than to assign to it' is listed as an unsafe operation requiring unsafe context.
MANUAL: Per FLS fls_kddnnz8uc15b: 'Reading the selected field of a union shall require unsafe context.' This is the enforcement mechanism for MISRA's concern.

rejected_matches.reason: About struct layout, not union - high similarity due to shared 'representation' terminology.

Parent section. Child 4.11.2.3 (Union Type Representation) is more specific and already accepted.
About char type, not unions. High score likely due to type representation terminology overlap.

mappings.guideline_title: A union member shall not be read unless it has been previously set
mappings.notes: FLS explicitly defines UB for reading union fields with invalid data (fls_Vani4665hiJY). Reading any union field requires unsafe context. Rust treats union field read-after-different-write as transmute, matching MISRA's type punning concern.

accepted_matches.reason: PRIMARY: Defines union field type restrictions (Copy/ManuallyDrop) which limit what can be stored and safely reinterpreted.

MANUAL: CRITICAL - Contains the explicit UB definition per FLS fls_Vani4665hiJY: 'It is undefined behavior reading the selected field of a union type when it contains data that is invalid for the selected field's type.' Also defines transmute equivalence for union field access (fls_t6xmsm2nk1bc).
Per FLS fls_ucghxcnpaq2t: Union field access (except assignment) is an unsafe operation. This forces explicit acknowledgment of the type punning risk.
Per FLS: 'All union fields share a common storage.' This is the memory model underlying MISRA's concern about reading unwritten members.
